result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfred Lee Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.   May transfer jail sentence to Dane County with electronic monitoring.  Stipulation will be filed for jail credit due.

**AMENDED** 09-02-15 To show 10 days of credit.

records.addlTxt: Atty Ryan Frank

Court called 4:05 PM. Defendant Alford Lee Jackson in court, in custody with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent Julie Basel present. Court orders 4 months of conditional jail time to defendants sentence. Court will not allow defendant to transfer to Dane County. Jail time to start forthwith with huber. Defendants name corrected on the record as Alfred not Alford. Court adjourned 4:27 PM.

Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Alford Lee Jackson in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quash warrant.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court dismissed near the park enhancer, withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years. Conditions of probation include:  $518.00 costs, AODA and comply, submit DNA sample, 60 days jail, with Huber work release.  Jail start 10/30/15 7:00 pm.  Stipulation to be filed for jail credit.  May transfer to Dane County with electronic monitoring.

Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
